keyword: how many calories are in 2 scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in 2 Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in 2 scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in 2 Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled in non-stick pan with 1 tsp butter total, no added milk, salt, or other ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and seasonings. Values are approximate; check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: Two large scrambled eggs offer about 182 kcal and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use 1 tsp oil instead of butter per egg

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 2 scrambled eggs?
Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 13.4 g total fat for two eggs, mostly from the yolks and cooking fat.

faqs.q: How does adding cheese affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: One slice of cheese per egg adds about 80 kcal, making two eggs ~342 kcal.

faqs.q: Are these values for scrambled or fried eggs?
faqs.a: Specific to scrambled with minimal added fat; fried eggs may have more calories from extra oil.
